channel.title: Sudachi on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Sudachi on Memo Tut

item.title: Sudachi Py accidentally made a tanka
item.description: # What is a chance tanka? It is twitter bot that I extract the part that happens to be 57577 from the text of wikipedia and post it. Here was created in 2015. The original one seems to be made of ruby+MeCab, so this time I will reheat it with Python and Sudachi. Thanks and respect to my seniors. #environment Windows10 Home (64bit) python 3.7.4 SudachiDict-full==20191224 SudachiPy==0.4.2 Environment built with pipenv

item.title: Add words to GiNZA(SudachiPy)'s user dictionary
item.description: #Introduction I’ve been involved in natural language processing for a few weeks, and until now I’ve often used R and MeCab, but recently I’m moving to hear that Python’s GiNZA is an excellent tool for natural language processing. First of all, I needed to add words that are not in the dictionary, so I tried to summarize the flow. #environment Ubuntu 16.04 Python 3.6 (pyenv/anaconda virtual environment) GiNZA 2.
